name: Dreg and Shantywood Isle
tagline: Rowdy Hameth port-town and the neighbouring isle of ill-repute
description: A rough port-town and fishing village founded amid the marshes and mists of the River Hameth's banks. Tall, wonky houses are clad with tarred wooden planks against the damp. The place is slumping inexorably into the bog and the river. Dreg has a seedy reputation as a haunt for thieves, charlatans, and rascals of all stripes.
atmosphere: Seedy, rowdy, and corrupt with growing violence and discord
inhabitants_description: A majority of humans of High Woldish descent have plied the river here for many generations, alongside a smaller population of shorthorns. As a centre of trade and transit, Dreg is also home to a significant population of folk from other regions.

governance.notes: Madame Shantywood, although she has no legally recognised position in Dreg, practically runs the port, due to her economic clout. Shantywood Isle is technically an independent country with the right to arbitrate its own laws.

religion.religious_practices: Ostensibly devotees of the Church, the rowdy folk of Dreg have a tendency towards godlessness. The rogue friar Brother Hogbeard and his flock of yellow-smocked zealots seek to reverse this trend.

history: Founded amid the marshes and mists of the River Hameth's banks by humans of High Woldish descent
Has been a centre of trade and transit for many generations
Brother Hogbeard came to Dreg five years ago to aid the poor but has become leader of religious vigilantes
An Atacorn has dwelt hidden in the town for some years, infusing corruption
current_events: Violence, treachery, and discord are on the rise due to the Atacorn's influence
Hogbeard's zealots have taken to kidnapping 'sinners' for nighttime exorcism
The Boghouse Boys are planning to infiltrate the Berkmaster's manor
rumors_reference: See Rumours in Dreg and Shantywood Isle, p445

special_features.name: The Atacorn's Miasma
special_features.description: An Atacorn—one of the spawn of Atanuwë—has dwelt hidden in the town for some years, infusing the town's smoked fish with its corrupting miasma

special_features.name: The River Trade
special_features.description: The River Hameth runs wide and shallow at this point and is rich with fish and floating debris from the forest. Forms vital trade links east-west and north-south.

special_features.name: Famed Bog-Swine Sausages
special_features.description: Dreg is known for its fine sausages, made from the flesh of huge, bristly, black swine kept in the bogs to the north of the village.

special_items: Pipeleaf at 50% price at Shodgerey's Shack
equipment_availability.notes: Vehicles and mounts cost 50% more than usual. Despite Dreg's status as a village, mercenary companies can occasionally be hired here (2-in-6 chance). Pipeleaf traded by sailors at reduced rates.

locations.name: The Ditchway
locations.description: The east-west road, known to locals as the Ditchway, winds through a broad channel with sandy banks on either side.
locations.exterior: Broad channel with sandy banks on either side
special_features: Leads to the market-town of Lankshorn

locations.name: The Mermaid's Arms
locations.description: The only reputable inn in Dreg, the Mermaid's Arms is little more than a cottage, but is homely and well maintained. Known colloquially as the 'Mermaid's Arse.'
locations.interior: Dark beams, floorboards decked with round woollen rugs, the scent of wood polish, and a cheery fireplace conjure an atmosphere at once welcoming and intimate. A sign reads 'No gambling, lewdness, or sea shanties!'
locations.exterior: A mermaid on the seashore, bashfully hiding her modesty with her immaculately braided blonde hair (sign)
locations.populace: A courteous mix of travellers and locals wishing for a quiet drink away from the crowds

services.name: Lodging
services.description: Common quality, only three 2-bed rooms and a single private room

services.name: Food
services.description: Common quality

services.name: Tweede's fish pie
services.description: Said to be the best in Dreg. Baked fresh every day

special_features: Attic suite with locked trapdoor - Tamrin's private residence and research laboratory
secrets: Tamrin Tweede's magical research laboratory in the attic

locations.name: Young Merble
locations.description: A bawdy marble statue of a busty mermaid at the centre of a fenced pool.
locations.exterior: Marble statue of busty mermaid in fenced pool
locations.populace: Dreg folk throwing coppers, occasional down-and-outs at night
special_features: Folk throw coppers for good luck
secrets: Pool dredgers steal coins at night

locations.name: Fish Market
locations.description: A cobblestoned square rammed with tarpaulin-draped market stalls.
locations.populace: Hawkers, customers, Brother Hogbeard and zealots during day
locations.atmosphere: Raucous cries of hawkers and the reek of fish—fresh and smoked—permeate all

locations.name: Berkmaster's Manor
locations.description: A tall, ungainly building clad with stained wood shingles and topped with a teetering bell tower. The manor is an odd structure that has been extended many times by Berkmasters over the centuries.
locations.interior: Extended many times over the centuries
locations.exterior: Raised on high stilts, directly facing Chateau Shantywood across the river. Great, goat-faced copper bell at summit of bell tower
locations.populace: Berkmaster Maximilian Monocleese and his sickly wife Hilda
special_features: The berk-bell - only rung upon arrival of longhorn noble

locations.name: Port
locations.description: A ramshackle assortment of piers, fishing boats, and river barges. Passage by water to nearby destinations can be bought here.
locations.populace: Boat operators, Brother Hogbeard and zealots in evening

services.name: Passage to Woodcutters' Encampment
services.description: 7-mile river journey, takes 2 hours
services.cost: 2sp per foot passenger, 5sp per horse, 2gp per vehicle

services.name: Passage to Shantywood Isle
services.description: Red-lanterned barges, evening and night only
services.notes: Foot passengers only, no animals or vehicles

special_features: River trade connections east-west and north-south

locations.name: Shodgerey's Shack
locations.description: A low-roofed, single storey doss-house favoured by the numerous sailors who find themselves in Dreg for a night. The cheapest place to stay in town, but hazardous for non-sailors.
locations.interior: A draughty hall, rammed with a jumble of rickety stools. An old fishing boat hangs from the rafters, keel down, its nets dangling at head height, festooned with crab shells and fish bones.
locations.exterior: A leering moon ringed with grimacing stars (sign)
locations.populace: Itinerant sailors and barge-folk. Raucous sea shanties and tussles over dice games are regular fixtures

services.name: Hammocks
services.description: Sleep in long, windowless hall lined with hammocks, nautical style

services.name: Food
services.description: Poor quality

services.name: Beverages
services.description: Only Pilston's Heartbreaker and Barrowblaster

services.name: Pipeleaf
services.description: All common pipeleafs available
services.notes: Only for those sailors take a shine to

secrets: Landlord takes cut of thievery profits

locations.name: Church of St Wick
locations.description: A mouldering wooden church beside the port, built upon a pier above the river. The church is dedicated to St Wick (patron saint of ferry-folk and amputees).
locations.interior: Dusty, musty wooden walls and pews. A tarnished pewter icon on the velvet-cloaked altar depicts St Wick with eyes raised to heaven, impaled with a horrid array of spears, arrows, and axes.
locations.exterior: Mouldering wooden church on pier above river. Once-solid oak door, now weathered and battered
locations.populace: A handful of pious locals, Reverend Mother Hadlewreath
locations.atmosphere: Poor state of repair indicating low esteem for organised religion

services.name: Prayer to St Wick
services.description: Characters praying may receive blessing: ability to cast Greater Healing

locations.name: The Smokehouse
locations.description: A tall, windowless building topped with a conical roof and a rusted iron chimney. The smokehouse is a communally owned facility for preserving fish by smoking.
locations.interior: Extensive cellars with towering stacks of firewood and smoking racks of various sizes
locations.exterior: Tall, windowless building with conical roof and rusted iron chimney
locations.atmosphere: Communal facility, but harboring hidden corruption

services.name: Fish smoking
services.description: Communal facility for preserving fish

secrets: Atacorn Crewithyant lurks in dark recesses of cellars

locations.name: The Spawning Salmon
locations.description: A squat, converted warehouse, now the favoured gambling establishment in Dreg and secret headquarters of the thieves' guild.
locations.interior: A wide hall packed with gambling tables. The smell of roasting meat wafts from the grill at one end, mingling with the reek of pipesmoke. A stage at the other end frequently hosts bawdy performances. Viewing balcony with plush leather couches and its own bar.
locations.exterior: A bright pink salmon leaping out of a stream, its mouth gaping after a dangling sausage pie (sign)
locations.populace: River workers, mercenaries, locals, and travellers in common room; merchants lounge above

services.name: Lodging
services.description: Common quality

services.name: Food
services.description: Common quality

services.name: Grilled sausages
services.description: A trio of bogswine sausages fresh from the grill, served in a bowl of ale gravy

services.name: Viewing balcony access
services.description: Access to balcony overlooking common room

services.name: Common and uncommon spirits
services.description: Only served from the bar on the viewing balcony

secrets: Secret thieves' guild headquarters in cellars

locations.name: The Boghouse
locations.description: The shell of a burned-out farmhouse, now used as the meeting house of a secret society who have dubbed the ruin 'the Boghouse' and themselves 'the Boghouse Boys.'
locations.interior: Collapsed beams and the blackened remnants of a few walls remain. Bracken and nettles crowd the space. Secret cellar decked out as meeting house with twelve stools, rickety table, rough map of Dreg and surrounding woodland, keg of ale, and pewter tankards.
locations.exterior: Burned-out farmhouse shell with bootprints and disturbed undergrowth marking path to secret trapdoor
locations.populace: Empty during day, 3-in-6 chance of 2d6 Boghouse Boys at night
special_features: Secret trapdoor under mound of rubble
secrets: Meeting place of Boghouse Boys secret society

locations.name: South Cove
locations.description: A small dock located in a wide cove in the cliff-ringed Shantywood Isle. Boats other than the barges operated by Madame Shantywood are not permitted to land directly.
locations.exterior: Small dock in wide cove with red banners bearing Madame Shantywood's coat of arms—seven golden coins encircling a black rose

services.name: Barge passage to Dreg
services.description: Red-lanterned barges, evening and night only

special_features: Red banners with coat of arms

locations.name: North Cove
locations.description: A broad, undecorated dock in a small cove at the north-eastern corner of Shantywood Isle, used for ferrying goods.
locations.exterior: Broad, undecorated dock in small cove
locations.populace: 2 soldiers (usually women) guard the dock at all hours
special_features: Steep stairway to servants' entrance of Chateau Shantywood

locations.name: Chateau Shantywood
locations.description: A manse of ostentatious turrets and flamboyant minarets at the summit of Shantywood Isle. The chateau is a much-frequented manor of ill-repute and home of the seductive and ruthless Madame Shantywood.
locations.interior: Stone-flagged hall with gaudy tapestries, crystal chandeliers, and a sea of gambling tables. Ballroom exclusively reserved for well-to-do patrons.
locations.populace: Boorish, drunken locals, wealthy merchants, minor nobility, successful adventurers, scantily-clad wait staff

services.name: Lodging
services.description: Fancy quality

services.name: Food
services.description: Common quality

services.name: Companionship
services.description: Private company of staff in Madame Shantywood's employ

secrets: Madame Shantywood's magic mirror granting access to shadow manse

npcs.name: Brother Rodger Hogbeard
npcs.title: Level 3 Friar
npcs.description: A plump, red-faced human man in his fifties, with bushy beard and eyebrows.
npcs.dress: Dressed in the hessian robes and tonsure of a friar, with a Chapes swinging from a chain around his neck
desires: For Dreg to be freed of sin
To be recognised by the Church for his holy deeds and be decreed a living saint
secrets: Was previously Lawful, but the Atacorn's influence has swayed him to increasing passion and violence
npcs.occupation: Friar and leader of religious vigilantes

npcs.name: Ogham Tweede
npcs.title: Level 3 Thief, Mermaid's Arms Bartender
npcs.description: A burly, rough-faced human man in his forties, with dense black stubble covering his face and head.
npcs.dress: Dresses in utilitarian leathers and white apron
demeanor: with an edge of cautionary pugnacity
npcs.mannerisms: Clenches his fists on the bar
npcs.speech: Consciously hushed, bursts of loud guffawing. Woldish.
desires: Word on the whereabouts of his ex-flame, One-Eyed Gil, whom he has not seen in 15 years, since the night they fled the grounds of Redwraith Manor following an aborted burglary
secrets: Reformed thief
Fled Redwraith Manor with One-Eyed Gil after failed burglary

npcs.name: Tamrin Tweede
npcs.title: Level 5 Magician, Mermaid's Arms Proprietor
npcs.description: An elderly human woman with a frizzy mane of white hair and tiny spectacles balanced on a pinched, mouse-like visage.
demeanor: Happy to converse with erudite visitors
desires: To uncover the cause of the growing violence and unrest in Dreg, which she suspects to be of magical origin
secrets: Retired adventurer
Has magical research laboratory in attic
Possesses Ring of Energy Resistance and spell books

npcs.name: Berkmaster Maximilian Monocleese
npcs.title: Berkmaster
npcs.description: A slight human man in his late fifties, with elegantly oiled and curled black hair.
npcs.dress: Dresses in black silk shirts and slacks and wears the silver fish's head medallion hereditary to his station
npcs.speech: Snide drawl. Woldish, patchy Old Woldish.
desires: Tired of his wife's long illness, wishes for her to either be healed of her afflictions (both physical and mental) or to pass peacefully
If Hilda's fate is death: to marry Madame Shantywood, whom he admires and secretly lusts after
secrets: Secretly lusts after Madame Shantywood

npcs.name: Lyren Shodgerey
npcs.title: Shodgerey's Shack Landlord
npcs.description: A squat, muscular human man in his late thirties, with a shaven head and half his teeth missing. Covered from head to toe in tattoos of malignant beings (harpies, crookhorns, ogres, etc.).
npcs.mannerisms: Wipes sweat from his head and face in a single motion
desires: Easy money—willing to go in on any crooked scheme
To found a rival thieves' guild in Dreg
secrets: Turns a blind eye to thievery in the Shack in return for a small cut of the profits

npcs.name: Reverend Mother Shandra Hadlewreath
npcs.title: Vicar of Dreg
npcs.description: An elderly, flabby human woman with fluffy white hair and a scratched monocle.
desires: To be left in peace and not be dragged into the unrest in Dreg
secrets: Has abandoned hope for the spiritual salvation of the people of Dreg

npcs.name: Sidley Crump
npcs.title: Spawning Salmon Landlord
npcs.description: A tall, wiry human man in his forties, with bulging eyes and long, greasy hair.
npcs.dress: Dresses in smart shirts and black leather trousers
npcs.mannerisms: Habitually rolls up his shirt sleeves
desires: To ascertain the true purpose of his wife Elmine's trips to Lankshorn 'to visit her ailing cousin.' (She is in love with Sydewich Maldwort)
secrets: Member of the thieves' guild and conceals the guild's presence from the law
Wife is having an affair

npcs.name: Brigg 'Hollowhand' Meagre
npcs.title: Leader of Boghouse Boys
npcs.description: A stocky, broad-shouldered human man in his late 30s, with shaven head, mop-like beard, and one wooden hand.
desires: For Dreg to be ruled by common folk of good sense and upstanding morality (e.g. himself)
secrets: Dreams haunted by false visions of great evils afoot in Dreg (the insinuations of the Atacorn Crewithyant)
Plans to infiltrate Berkmaster's manor
npcs.occupation: Bog-swine farmer and secret society leader

npcs.name: Madame Chandilore Shantywood
npcs.title: Lady of Shantywood Isle
npcs.description: A bewitching human woman approaching 50, with cascading, raven locks and eyes of striking green.
npcs.dress: Dresses in an antiquated style, with black lace dress, layered petticoats, tightly strung corset, and heavily powdered face
demeanor: Merciless in punishing those who cross her
npcs.mannerisms: Habitually gazes into an ivory hand mirror, reapplying her face powder with a feathery puff
npcs.speech: Eminently refined, mischievously demeaning, callously frank. Woldish, Old Woldish.
desires: The amorous attentions of the sorceress Myrrsian, whom she has spied in the ballroom on occasion
The painful death of Lord Murkin who slew her eldest daughter many years ago
To keep the identity of her children's father (the gentleman in the mirror) secret
secrets: Possesses a magic mirror granting access to a dusty, dreamy shadow manse ruled by a spectral gentleman
The spectral gentleman is the father of her children
npcs.occupation: Ruler of independent micro-domain and manor proprietor

entries.description: 1d4 longhorns (DMB)—knights in the service of Lord Malbleat (p64)—charge into town, bearing urgent news to Berkmaster Monocleese.
Brother Hogbeard and 1d3 zealots approach PCs asking for a donation to their cause.
2d3 fishermen come to blows outside the Smokehouse over a disagreement about who owns a batch of fish.
1d4 town guards chase a pickpocket through the streets. Onlookers jeer and throw fish guts.
1d4 shifty lads (members of the Boghouse Boys—see p145) staking out the Berkmaster's manor.
1d3 Hogbeard's zealots drag a "sinner" to the church.
1d4+1 thugs (as Level 1 thieves—DMB) follow an old lady (Tamrin Tweede, p142) into a dark alleyway. Loud cursing ensues, as the thugs are caught in her Web.
1d4+1 thugs (as Level 1 thieves—DMB), looking for prey.
1d3 farmhands drunkenly bragging about witch-hunting, on their way to a secret meeting in the Boghouse.
A rowdy fistfight between 3d6 sailors (two rival gangs).
2d3 Hogbeard's zealots, bearing torches, dragging a blindfolded "sinner" into the woods for exorcism.
Folk stumble indoors as a thick mist rolls off the river.

monsters.name: Crewithyant
monsters.description: A naked, emaciated, gangly (6′ tall) man-thing with warty, ashen skin and the decaying head of a unicorn. Crewithyant is a child of the Nag-Lord, sent out into the world to spread discord and woe.

special_abilities.name: Disease
special_abilities.description: The victim must Save Versus Doom or suffer 1d3 damage per day, their flesh erupting in grey lumps.

special_abilities.name: Gaseous form
special_abilities.description: Crewithyant can dissolve his physical form—including clothing and equipment—into a sooty vapour at will. The process takes 1 Round, as does re-coalescing. In gaseous form, he is immune to mundane damage and can seep through small cracks.
